name: 數位學習理論
description: E-learning offers a great deal of promise to learners, yet e-learning must be implemented appropriately. This graduate level course for doctoral students will explore the theoretical foundation and rationale for the successful integration of e-learning into a variety of formal and informal learning environments and address the many factors that need to be considered in the design and delivery of e-learning.
goals: 能夠瞭解數位學習環境中知識建構的理論架構和哲學取向，包括數位科技如何改變或影響學習的發生
能夠將數位學習相關的理論哲學轉化成學習者在不同環境與不同設置中有效學習的內容與實踐
能夠瞭解數位學習相較於傳統面對面教學的特色，掌握不同數位學習形式可以帶來的教學效益與互動類型／層次，並分析有效實施數位學習應考慮的設計要素
能夠認同數位學習對當代教學者與學習者的重要性與效益，並且掌握國內外數位學習的現況、理論、研究與趨勢
syllabus:
E-learning offers a great deal of promise to learners, yet e-learning must be implemented appropriately. This graduate level course for doctoral students will explore the theoretical foundation and rationale for the successful integration of e-learning into a variety of formal and informal learning environments and address the many factors that need to be considered in the design and delivery of e-learning.

The following topics will be covered:

*   Definition: What is e-learning?
*   The growth and evolution of e-learning
*   Learning theory: Behaviorist, cognitivist and constructivist approaches
*   Learning theory: Connectivist approach
*   Designing e-learning content and practice
*   Methods of delivering e-learning
*   Methods of assessing e-learning
*   Evaluation techniques in e-Learning
*   Use of mobile devices for e-learning
*   Emerging trends in e-learnin

The coursework will involve reading and critiquing research papers each week, as well as leading 1-2 discussions of research papers. There will be a required project for those students taking this course, and the scope and focus of the project will vary, depending on the interests and backgrounds of the students. The students will learn about and practice research skills, such as writing a technical paper, critically reading research papers, and giving a technical presentation.
